Input GenerationÔÉÅ

In this section the most useful classes that can be used during benchmark input preparation are described.

matreader moduleÔÉÅ

MatCardsListÔÉÅ

class matreader.MatCardsList(materials)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Sequence

Object representing the list of materials included in an MCNP input. This class is a child of the Sequence base class.

Parameters:

materials (list[Material]) ‚Äì list of materials.

Return type:

None.

classmethod from_input(inputfile)ÔÉÅ

This method use the numjuggler parser to help identify the mcards in the input. Then the mcards are parsed using the classes defined in this module

Parameters:

  • cls (TYPE) ‚Äì DESCRIPTION.

  • inputfile (os.PathLike) ‚Äì MCNP input file containing the material section.

Returns:

new material card list generated.

Return type:

MatCardsList

get_info(lib_manager, zaids=False, complete=False)ÔÉÅ

Get the material informations in terms of fraction and composition of the material card

Parameters:

  • lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì To handle element name recovering.

  • zaids (bool, optional) ‚Äì Consider or not the zaid level. The default is False.

  • complete (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True both the atom and mass fraction are given in the raw table. The default is False.

Returns:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Raw infos on the fractions.

  • df_elem (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì processed info for the element: normalized fraction added both for material and submaterial.

to_text()ÔÉÅ

return text of the material cards in order

Returns:

material card list MCNP formatted text.

Return type:

str

to_xml(libmanager) → strÔÉÅ

Generate an XML representation of materials and return it as a string.

Parameters:

libmanager ‚Äì libmanager

Returns:

The XML representation of materials as a string.

Return type:

str

translate(newlib, lib_manager, code='mcnp')ÔÉÅ

This method allows to translate the material cards to another library. The zaid are collapsed again to get the new elements

Parameters:

  • newlib (dict or str) ‚Äì

    There are a few ways that newlib can be provided:

    1) str (e.g. 31c), the new library to translate to will be the one indicated;

    2) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô : ‚Äò99c‚Äô, ‚Äò31c: 32c‚Äô}), the new library is determined based on the old library of the zaid

    3) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô: [list of zaids], ‚Äò31c‚Äô: [list of zaids]}), the new library to be used is explicitly stated depending on the zaidnum.

  • lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

Return type:

None.

update_info(lib_manager)ÔÉÅ

This methods allows to update the in-line comments for every zaids containing additional information

Parameters:

lib_manager (libmanager.Libmanager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

Return type:

None.

MaterialÔÉÅ

class matreader.Material(zaids, elem, name, submaterials=None, mx_cards=[], header=None, density=None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Object representing a material

Parameters:

  • zaids (list[zaids]) ‚Äì zaids composing the material.

  • elem (list[elem]) ‚Äì elements composing the material.

  • name (str) ‚Äì name of the material (e.g. m1).

  • submaterials (list[Submaterials], optional) ‚Äì list of submaterials composing the material. The default is None.

  • mx_cards (list, optional) ‚Äì list of mx_cards in the material if present. The default is [].

  • header (str, optional) ‚Äì material header. The default is None.

  • density (float, optional) ‚Äì material density. Default is None.

Return type:

None.

add_mx(mx_cards)ÔÉÅ

Add a list of mx_cards to the material

classmethod from_text(text)ÔÉÅ

Create a material from transport code formatted text.

Parameters:

  • cls (TYPE) ‚Äì DESCRIPTION.

  • text (list[str]) ‚Äì Transport code formatted text.

Returns:

material object created.

Return type:

matreader.Material

get_tot_fraction()ÔÉÅ

Returns the total material fraction

switch_fraction(ftype, lib_manager, inplace=True)ÔÉÅ

Switch between atom or mass fraction for the material card. If the material is already switched the command is ignored.

Parameters:

  • ftype (str) ‚Äì Either ‚Äòmass‚Äô or ‚Äòatom‚Äô to chose the type of switch.

  • lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Handles zaid data.

  • inplace (bool) ‚Äì if True the densities of the isotopes are changed inplace, otherwise a copy of the material is provided. DEFAULT is True

Raises:

KeyError ‚Äì if ftype is not either ‚Äòatom‚Äô or ‚Äòmass‚Äô.

Returns:

submaterials ‚Äì list of the submaterials where fraction have been switched

Return type:

list

to_text()ÔÉÅ

Write the material to transport code formatted text.

Returns:

Transport code formatted text representing the material.

Return type:

str

to_xml(libmanager, material_tree)ÔÉÅ

Generate XML content for a material and its submaterials.

Parameters:

  • libmanager ‚Äì libmanager

  • material_tree ‚Äì The XML element for the material where content will be added.

translate(newlib, lib_manager, code='mcnp', update=True)ÔÉÅ

This method allows to translate all submaterials to another library

Parameters:

  • newlib (dict or str) ‚Äì

    There are a few ways that newlib can be provided:

    1) str (e.g. 31c), the new library to translate to will be the one indicated;

    2) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô : ‚Äò99c‚Äô, ‚Äò31c: 32c‚Äô}), the new library is determined based on the old library of the zaid

    3) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô: [list of zaids], ‚Äò31c‚Äô: [list of zaids]}), the new library to be used is explicitly stated depending on the zaidnum.

  • lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì object handling all libraries operations.

  • update (bool, optional) ‚Äì if True, material infos are updated. The default is True.

Return type:

None.

update_info(lib_manager)ÔÉÅ

This methods allows to update the in-line comments for every zaids containing additional information

lib_manager: (LibManager) Library manager for the conversion

SubmaterialÔÉÅ

class matreader.SubMaterial(name, zaidList, elemList=None, header=None, additional_keys=[])ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Generate a SubMaterial Object starting from a list of Zaid and eventually Elements list

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì if the first submaterial, the name is the name of the material (e.g. m1).

  • zaidList (list[Zaid]) ‚Äì list of zaids composing the submaterial.

  • elemList (list[Element], optional) ‚Äì list of elements composing the submaterial. The default is None.

  • header (str, optional) ‚Äì Header of the submaterial. The default is None.

  • additional_keys (list[str], optional) ‚Äì list of additional keywords in the submaterial. The default is [].

Return type:

None.

collapse_zaids()ÔÉÅ

Organize zaids into their elements and collapse multiple instances

Return type:

None.

classmethod from_text(text)ÔÉÅ

Generate a submaterial from MCNP input text

Parameters:

  • cls (SubMaterial) ‚Äì submaterial to be generated.

  • text (list[str]) ‚Äì Original text of the MCNP input.

Returns:

generated submaterial.

Return type:

SubMaterial

get_info(lib_manager)ÔÉÅ

Returns DataFrame containing the different fractions of the elements and zaids

Parameters:

lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

Returns:

  • df_el (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì table of information of the submaterial on an elemental level.

  • df_zaids (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì table of information of the submaterial on a zaid level.

scale_fractions(norm_factor)ÔÉÅ

norm_factor (float) ‚Äì scaling factor.

None.

formatted submaterial text.

to_xml(libmanager, material) → NoneÔÉÅ

Generate XML content for a material and add it to a material tree.

Parameters:

  • libmanager ‚Äì libmanager handling the libraries operations.

  • material ‚Äì The XML tree where the material content will be added.

translate(newlib, lib_manager, code)ÔÉÅ

This method implements the translation logic of JADE. All zaids are translated accordingly to the newlib specified.

Parameters:

  • newlib (dict or str) ‚Äì

    There are a few ways that newlib can be provided:

    1) str (e.g. 31c), the new library to translate to will be the one indicated;

    2) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô : ‚Äò99c‚Äô, ‚Äò31c: 32c‚Äô}), the new library is determined based on the old library of the zaid

    3) dic (e.g. {‚Äò98c‚Äô: [list of zaids], ‚Äò31c‚Äô: [list of zaids]}), the new library to be used is explicitly stated depending on the zaidnum.

  • lib_manager (LibManager) ‚Äì Object handling libraries operation.

Return type:

None.

update_info(lib_manager)ÔÉÅ

This methods allows to update the in-line comments for every zaids containing additional information

Parameters:

lib_manager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

Return type:

None.

ElementÔÉÅ

class matreader.Element(zaidList)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Generate an Element object starting from a list of zaids. It will collapse multiple instance of a zaid into a single one

Parameters:

zaidList (list) ‚Äì list of zaids constituing the element.

Return type:

None.

get_fraction()ÔÉÅ

Get the sum of the fraction of the zaids composing the element

Returns:

fraction ‚Äì element fraction.

Return type:

float

update_zaidinfo(libmanager)ÔÉÅ

Update zaids infos through a libmanager. Info are the formula name and the abundance in the material.

Parameters:

libmanager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì libmanager handling the libraries operations.

Return type:

None.

ZaidÔÉÅ

class matreader.Zaid(fraction, element, isotope, library, ab='', fullname='')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Object representing a Zaid

Parameters:

  • fraction (str/float) ‚Äì fraction of the zaid.

  • element (str) ‚Äì element part of the zaid (AA).

  • isotope (str) ‚Äì isotope part of the zaid (ZZZ).

  • library (str) ‚Äì library suffix (e.g. 99c).

  • ab (str, optional) ‚Äì abundance of the zaid in the material. The default is ‚Äò‚Äô.

  • fullname (str, optional) ‚Äì formula name (e.g. H1). The default is ‚Äò‚Äô.

Return type:

None.

created zaid.

testrun moduleÔÉÅ

TestÔÉÅ

class testrun.Test(inp, lib, config, log, VRTpath, confpath, runoption)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class representing a general test. This class will have to be extended for specific tests.

Parameters:

  • inp (str) ‚Äì path to inputfile blueprint.

  • lib (str) ‚Äì library suffix to use (e.g. 31c).

  • config (pd.DataFrame (single row)) ‚Äì configuration options for the test.

  • log (Log) ‚Äì Jade log file access.

  • VRTpath (path like object) ‚Äì path to the variance reduction folder.

  • confpath (path like object) ‚Äì path to the test configuration folder.

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì if the code specified in config is not admissible.

Return type:

None.

custom_inp_modifications()ÔÉÅ

Perform additional operation on the input before generation. In this parent object actually does nothing

Return type:

None.

generate_test(lib_directory, libmanager, run_dir=None)ÔÉÅ

Generate the test input files

Parameters:

  • lib_directory (path or string) ‚Äì Path to lib benchmarks input folders.

  • libmanager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Manager dealing with libraries operations.

  • MCNPdir (str or path) ‚Äì allows to ovewrite the MCNP dir if needed. The default is None

Return type:

None.

job_submission(config, directory: str, run_command: list, mpi_tasks: int, omp_threads: int, env_variables: str, data_command='') → NoneÔÉÅ

Submits a job script to the users batch system for running in parallel.

Parameters:

  • config ‚Äì Configuration settings

  • directory ‚Äì Job working directory

  • run_command (list) ‚Äì Executable command

  • mpi_tasks (int) ‚Äì Number of MPI tasks

  • omp_threads (int) ‚Äì Number of OMP threads

  • env_variables (str) ‚Äì user specified/ code specific environment variables

  • data_command (str, optional) ‚Äì user specified/ code specific environment variables, by default str()

run(config, libmanager, runoption: str) → NoneÔÉÅ

run the input

Parameters:

  • config ‚Äì Configuration settings

  • libmanager ‚Äì libmanager

  • runoption (str) ‚Äì

run_mcnp(config, lib_manager, name: str, directory: Path, runoption: str, timeout=None) → boolÔÉÅ

Run MCNP simulation either on the command line or submitted as a job.

Parameters:

  • config ‚Äì Configuration settings

  • lib_manager ‚Äì libmanager

  • name (str) ‚Äì Name of the simulation

  • directory (str, path) ‚Äì Directory where the simulation will be executed

  • runoption (str) ‚Äì Whether JADE run in parallel or command line

  • timeout (float, optional) ‚Äì Maximum time to wait for simulation of complete, by default None

Returns:

Flag if simulation not run

Return type:

bool

  • runoption (str) ‚Äì Whether JADE run in parallel or command line

  • timeout (float, optional) ‚Äì Maximum time to wait for simulation of complete, by default None

Flag if simulation not run

bool

MultipleTestÔÉÅ

class testrun.MultipleTest(inpsfolder, lib, config, log, VRTpath, confpath, runoption, TestOb=<class 'testrun.Test'>)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A collection of Tests

Parameters:

  • inpsfolder (path-like object) ‚Äì folder that contains all inputs of the tests.

  • lib (str) ‚Äì library suffix to use (e.g. 31c).

  • config (pd.DataFrame (single row)) ‚Äì configuration options for the test.

  • log (Log) ‚Äì Jade log file access.

  • VRTpath (path like object) ‚Äì path to the variance reduction folder.

  • confpath (path like object) ‚Äì path to the test configuration folder.

  • TestOb (testrun.Test, optional) ‚Äì type of test object to be used. The default is Test.

Return type:

None.

generate_test(lib_directory, libmanager)ÔÉÅ

Generate all the tests of the collection

Parameters:

  • lib_directory (path-like) ‚Äì output directory where to generate the tests.

  • libmanager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì object handling libraries operations.

Return type:

None.

run(cpu=1, timeout=None)ÔÉÅ

Run all the tests

Parameters:

  • cpu (int, optional) ‚Äì number of CPU to be used. The default is 1.

  • timeout (int, optional) ‚Äì number of seconds after each simulation is killed. The default is None.

Return type:

None.

Bases: object

  • matlist (matreader.MatCardList) ‚Äì material list in the input.

  • name (str, optional) ‚Äì name associated with the file. The default is None.

Return type:

None.

add_stopCard(nps)ÔÉÅ

Add STOP card

Parameters:

  • nps (int) ‚Äì number of particles to simulate.

  • ctme (int) ‚Äì copmuter time.

  • precision ((str, float)) ‚Äì tally number, precision.

Return type:

None.

addlines2card(lines, blockID, cardID, offset_all=True)ÔÉÅ

Append some lines to one of the cards in the input

Parameters:

  • lines (list or str) ‚Äì list of lines to be appended to the card. If a string is given, this is wrapped

  • blockID (str) ‚Äì either ‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòsurf‚Äô, ‚Äòsettings‚Äô or ‚Äòtitle‚Äô.

  • cardID (str or int) ‚Äì card ID (e.g. FC22).

  • offset_all (bool, optional) ‚Äì if True all the lines are off-setted with whitespace. If False the first line will have no offset (new card)

Returns:

  • bool

  • if lines have been successfully added return True, otherwise False.

change_density(density, cellidx=1)ÔÉÅ

Change the density of the sphere according to the selected zaid

Parameters:

  • density (str/float) ‚Äì density to apply.

  • cellidx (int, optional) ‚Äì cell index where to modify the density. The default is 1.

Return type:

None.

classmethod from_text(inputfile)ÔÉÅ

This method use the numjuggler parser to help identify the mcards in the input which will usually undergo special treatments in the input creation

Parameters:

  • cls (TYPE) ‚Äì DESCRIPTION.

  • inputfile (path like object) ‚Äì path to the MCNP input file.

Return type:

None.

get_card_byID(blockID, cardID)ÔÉÅ

Get a card of the input based on its ID

Parameters:

  • blockID (str) ‚Äì either ‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòsurf‚Äô, ‚Äòsettings‚Äô or ‚Äòtitle‚Äô.

  • cardID (str or int) ‚Äì card ID (e.g. FC22).

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì if blockID is not allowed.

Returns:

card ‚Äì Selected card. If the card is not found, None is returned

Return type:

numjuggler.parser.Card

static mcnp_wrap(text, maxchars=80, whitespace='      ', offset_all=True)ÔÉÅ

Wrap the text of a card in MCNP style

Parameters:

  • text (str) ‚Äì text of the card to be formatted.

  • maxchars (int, optional) ‚Äì max limit of chars in one line. The default is 80.

  • whitespace (str, optional) ‚Äì whitespace to be put in front of newlines. The default is ‚Äò ‚Äò.

  • offset_all (bool, optional) ‚Äì if True all the lines are off-setted with whitespace. If False the first line will have no offset (new card)

Returns:

list of correctly wrapped line of a card expressing the initial text.

Return type:

list

  • libmanager (libmanager.LibManager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

add_track_contribution(tallyID, zaids, who='parent')ÔÉÅ

Given a list of zaid add the FU bin in the requested tallies in order to collect the contribution of them to the tally.

Parameters:

  • tallyID (str) ‚Äì ID of the tally onto which to operate (e.g. F4:p).

  • zaids (str) ‚Äì zaid number of the parent/daughter (e.g. 1001).

  • who (str, optional) ‚Äì either ‚Äòparent‚Äô or ‚Äòdaughter‚Äô specifies the types of zaids to be tracked. The default is ‚Äòparent‚Äô.

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì check for admissible who parameter.

Returns:

return True if lines were added correctly

Return type:

bool

get_reaction_file(libmanager, lib)ÔÉÅ

Collect all the possible reactions that are allowed amnong all the materials in the input

Parameters:

  • libmanager (LibManager) ‚Äì Object handling all cross-sections related operations.

  • lib (str) ‚Äì library suffix to be used.

Returns:

Object representing the react file for D1S.

Return type:

ReactionFile

translate(newlib, libmanager, original_irradfile=None, original_reacfile=None)ÔÉÅ

Translate the input to another library. This methods ovverride the parent one since often two different libraries must be considered in a D1S input: a tranport and an activation library

Parameters:

  • newlib (str) ‚Äì suffix of the new lib to translate to.

  • libmanager (LibManager) ‚Äì Library manager for the conversion.

  • original_irradfile (d1s_parser.IrradiationFile, optional) ‚Äì original irradiation file. The default is None.

  • original_reacfile (d1s_parser.ReactionFile, optional) ‚Äì original reaction file. The default is None.

Returns:

  • newirradiations (list) ‚Äì list of Irradiation objects coming from the translation.

  • newreactions (list) ‚Äì list of Reactions objects coming from the translation.

add_stopCard(nps, ctme, precision)ÔÉÅ

STOP card is not supported in MCNP 5. This simply is translated to a nps card. Warnings are prompt to the user if ctme or precision are specified.

Parameters:

  • nps (int) ‚Äì number of particles to simulate

  • int (ctme =) ‚Äì computer time

  • (str (precision =) ‚Äì tuple indicating the tally number and the precision requested

  • float) ‚Äì tuple indicating the tally number and the precision requested

Return type:

None.

parsersD1S moduleÔÉÅ

IrradiationFileÔÉÅ

class parsersD1S.IrradiationFile(nsc, irr_schedules, header=None, formatting=[8, 14, 13, 9], name='irrad')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Object representing an irradiation D1S file

Parameters:

  • nsc (int) ‚Äì number of irradiation schedule.

  • irr_schedules (list of Irradiation object) ‚Äì contains all irradiation objects.

  • header (str, optional) ‚Äì Header of the file. The default is None.

  • formatting (list of int, optional) ‚Äì fwf values for the output columns. The default is [8, 14, 13, 9].

  • name (str, optional) ‚Äì name of the file. The default is ‚Äòirrad‚Äô.

Return type:

None.

classmethod from_text(filepath)ÔÉÅ

Parse irradiation file

Parameters:

class parsersD1S.Irradiation(daughter, lambd, times, comment=None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Irradiation object

Parameters:

  • daughter (str) ‚Äì daughter nuclide (e.g. 24051).

  • lambd (str) ‚Äì disintegration constant [1/s].

  • times (list of strings) ‚Äì time correction factors.

  • comment (str, optional) ‚Äì comment to the irradiation. The default is None.

change_lib(newlib, libmanager=None)ÔÉÅ

change the parent library tag of the reactions. If no libmanager is provided, the check on the availability of the parent in the xsdir file will be not performed.

Parameters:

  • libmanager (LibManager, optional) ‚Äì Object managing library operations. The default is None.

ReactionÔÉÅ

class parsersD1S.Reaction(parent, MT, daughter, comment=None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Represents a single reaction of the reaction file

Parameters:

  • parent (str) ‚Äì parent nuclide ZZAAA.XXc representing stable isotope to be activated. ZZ and AAA represent the atomic and mass number and extension XX, is the extension number of the modified D1S library.

  • MT (str) ‚Äì integer, reaction type (ENDF definition).

  • daughter (str) ‚Äì integer, tag of the daughter nuclide. The value could be defined as ZZAAA of daughter nuclide, but any other identification type (with integer value) can be used.

  • comment (str, optional) ‚Äì comment to the reaction. The default is None.

Return type:

None.

change_lib(newlib)ÔÉÅ

Change the library tag

Parameters:

newlib (str) ‚Äì (e.g. 52c).

Return type:

None.
